main event: A silver-colored object with a blaze on top or trailing, moving fast at approximately 2,000 feet, was reported by a civilian pilot near Carbondale, Illinois on February 3, 1960.
interesting points: The object was described as a meteor or rocket-like in appearance.
The pilot who initially reported the sighting could not be contacted for further information.
The sighting was limited in detail, and insufficient for a thorough analysis.
The object was observed at 2,000 feet altitude and moving eastward.
Ground radar also detected the object, which was reported to the air defense command.
sighted object: A silver-colored object with a blaze on top or trailing
